name: Michael Anthony TAYLOR, petitioner, v. George A. LOMBARDI, Director, Missouri Department of Corrections, et al.

court.name: Supreme Court of the United States

parties:
Michael Anthony TAYLOR, petitioner,
v.
George A. LOMBARDI, Director, Missouri Department of Corrections, et al.
attorneys: Application for stay of execution of sentence of death presented to Justice ALITO
and by him referred to the Court denied. Petition for writ of certiorari to the United States Court of Appeals for the Eighth Circuit denied.
For reasons well stated by Judge BYE in his statement calling for Eighth Circuit rehearing en banc, I would grant the stay and consider the petition for certiorari in the ordinary course.
casebody.head_matter:
Michael Anthony TAYLOR, petitioner,
v.
George A. LOMBARDI, Director, Missouri Department of Corrections, et al.
No. 13-8856 (13A867).
Supreme Court of the United States
Feb. 25, 2014.
Application for stay of execution of sentence of death presented to Justice ALITO
and by him referred to the Court denied. Petition for writ of certiorari to the United States Court of Appeals for the Eighth Circuit denied.
Justice GINSBURG, with whom Justice SOTOMAYOR and Justice KAGAN join, dissenting.
For reasons well stated by Judge BYE in his statement calling for Eighth Circuit rehearing en banc, I would grant the stay and consider the petition for certiorari in the ordinary course.
